template.name: Template Tel Asterisk by HTTP
template.description:
The template gets Asterisk metrics from AMI by HTTP agent. You should enable the mini-HTTP Server, add the option webenabled=yes in the general section of the manager.conf file and create Asterisk Manager user with system and command write permissions within your Asterisk instance. Disable the PJSIP driver if you do not use PJSIP or do not have PJSIP endpoints. Please, define AMI address in the {$AMI.URL} macro. Also, the Zabbix host should have an Agent interface with the AMI address to check Asterisk service status. Then you can define {$AMI.USERNAME} and {$AMI.SECRET} macros in the template for using on the host level. If there are errors, increase the logging to debug level and see the Zabbix server log.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/410060-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-asterisk
Template tooling version used: 0.38

item.name: Asterisk: Active calls
item.description: The number of active calls at the moment.

item.name: Asterisk: Active channels
item.description: The number of active channels at the moment.

item.name: Asterisk: Calls processed
item.description: The number of calls processed after the last service restart.

item.name: Asterisk: Calls processed per second
item.description: The number of calls processed per second.

item.name: Asterisk: Get stats
item.description: Asterisk system information in JSON format.

item.name: Asterisk: IAX trunks active channels
item.description: The total number of IAX trunks active channels.

trigger.name: Asterisk: Total number of active channels of IAX trunks is too high (over {$AMI.TRUNK_ACTIVE_CHANNELS_TOTAL.MAX.WARN:"IAX"} for 10m)
trigger.description: The IAX trunks may not be able to process new calls.

item.name: Asterisk: IAX offline peers
item.description: The number of offline IAX peers.

item.name: Asterisk: IAX online peers
item.description: The number of online IAX peers.

item.name: Asterisk: IAX peers
item.description: The total number of IAX peers.

item.name: Asterisk: IAX unmonitored peers
item.description: The number of unmonitored IAX peers.

item.name: Asterisk: PJSIP trunks active channels
item.description: The total number of PJSIP trunks active channels.

trigger.name: Asterisk: Total number of active channels of PJSIP trunks is too high (over {$AMI.TRUNK_ACTIVE_CHANNELS_TOTAL.MAX.WARN:"PJSIP"} for 10m)
trigger.description: The PJSIP trunks may not be able to process new calls.

item.name: Asterisk: PJSIP available endpoints
item.description: The number of available PJSIP peers.

item.name: Asterisk: PJSIP endpoints
item.description: The total number of PJSIP peers.

item.name: Asterisk: PJSIP unavailable endpoints
item.description: The number of unavailable PJSIP peers.

item.name: Asterisk: SIP trunks active channels
item.description: The total number of SIP trunks active channels.

trigger.name: Asterisk: Total number of active channels of SIP trunks is too high (over {$AMI.TRUNK_ACTIVE_CHANNELS_TOTAL.MAX.WARN:"SIP"} for 10m)
trigger.description: The SIP trunks may not be able to process new calls.

item.name: Asterisk: SIP monitored offline
item.description: The number of monitored offline SIP peers.

item.name: Asterisk: SIP monitored online
item.description: The number of monitored online SIP peers.

item.name: Asterisk: SIP peers
item.description: The total number of SIP peers.

item.name: Asterisk: SIP unmonitored offline
item.description: The number of unmonitored offline SIP peers.

item.name: Asterisk: SIP unmonitored online
item.description: The number of unmonitored online SIP peers.

item.name: Asterisk: Total queues
item.description: The number of configured queues.

item.name: Asterisk: Uptime
item.description: System uptime in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

trigger.name: Asterisk: Failed to fetch AMI page (or no data for 30m)
trigger.description: Zabbix has not received data for items for the last 30 minutes.

item.name: Asterisk: Uptime after reload
item.description: System uptime after a config reload in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

item.name: Asterisk: Version
item.description: Service version

trigger.name: Asterisk: Version has changed (new version: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Asterisk version has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Asterisk: Service response time
item.description: Asterisk Manager API performance.

trigger.name: Asterisk: Service response time is too high (over {$AMI.RESPONSE_TIME.MAX.WARN} for 5m)

item.name: Asterisk: Service status
item.description: Asterisk Manager API port avalability.

item_prototype.name: IAX trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Active channels
item_prototype.description: The total number of active IAX trunk channels.

trigger_prototype.name: IAX trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Number of the IAX trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}" active channels is too high (over {$AMI.TRUNK_ACTIVE_CHANNELS.MAX.WARN:"{#OBJECTNAME}"} for 10m)
trigger_prototype.description: The IAX trunk may not be able to process new calls.

item_prototype.name: IAX trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Status
item_prototype.description: IAX trunk status. Here are the possible states that a device state may have: Unmonitored UNKNOWN UNREACHABLE OK

trigger_prototype.name: IAX trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": IAX trunk {#OBJECTNAME} has a state {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: The IAX trunk is unable to establish a connection with a neighbor due to network issues or incorrect configuration.

item_prototype.name: PJSIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Active channels
item_prototype.description: The total number of active PJSIP trunk channels.

trigger_prototype.name: PJSIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Number of the PJSIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}" active channels is too high (over {$AMI.TRUNK_ACTIVE_CHANNELS.MAX.WARN:"{#OBJECTNAME}"} for 10m)
trigger_prototype.description: The PJSIP trunk may not be able to process new calls.

item_prototype.name: PJSIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Device state
item_prototype.description: PJSIP trunk status. Here are the possible states that a device state may have: Unavailable Not in use In use

trigger_prototype.name: PJSIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": PJSIP trunk {#OBJECTNAME} has a state Unavailable
trigger_prototype.description: The PJSIP trunk is unable to establish a connection with a neighbor due to network issues or incorrect configuration.

item_prototype.name: "{#QUEUE}": Available
item_prototype.description: The number of available queue members.

item_prototype.name: "{#QUEUE}": Callers
item_prototype.description: The number incoming calls in queue.

trigger_prototype.name: "{#QUEUE}": Number of callers in the queue "{#QUEUE}" is too high (over {$AMI.QUEUE_CALLERS.MAX.WARN:"{#QUEUE}"} for 10m)
trigger_prototype.description: There is a large number of calls in the queue.

item_prototype.name: SIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Active channels
item_prototype.description: The total number of active SIP trunk channels.

trigger_prototype.name: SIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Number of the SIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}" active channels is too high (over {$AMI.TRUNK_ACTIVE_CHANNELS.MAX.WARN:"{#OBJECTNAME}"} for 10m)
trigger_prototype.description: The SIP trunk may not be able to process new calls.

item_prototype.name: SIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": Status
item_prototype.description: SIP trunk status. Here are the possible states that a device state may have: Unmonitored UNKNOWN UNREACHABLE OK

trigger_prototype.name: SIP trunk "{#OBJECTNAME}": SIP trunk {#OBJECTNAME} has a state {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: The SIP trunk is unable to establish a connection with a neighbor due to network issues or incorrect configuration.

macro.description: AMI port number for checking service availability.
The maximum number of callers in a queue for trigger expression.
The Asterisk Manager API page maximum response time in seconds for trigger expression.
The total maximum number of busy channels of IAX trunks for trigger expression.
The total maximum number of busy channels of PJSIP trunks for trigger expression.
The total maximum number of busy channels of SIP trunks for trigger expression.
The maximum number of busy channels of a trunk for trigger expression.
The regexp for the identification of trunk peers.
The Asterisk Manager API URL in the format `<scheme>://<host>:<port>/<prefix>/rawman`.
